Israel moves toward Netanyahu-led October 7 inquiry as Qatar scandal deepens
subhead: The Knesset passed a bill in its first reading to establish a special commission of inquiry into the failures of October 7, in line with the wishes of Benjamin Netanyahu, who has rejected the idea of a more independent body. However, he now faces difficulties over his advisers' ties to Qatar.

Chile election: 'The trauma of the 2020 protest movement has fueled the country's conservative shift'
subhead: Claudia Heiss, a political scientist at the University of Chile, analyzes the factors behind the popular vote that brought the ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast to power on December 14.

title: The flights of fancy of the French entrepreneur who brought Shein to Paris
subhead: Since bringing Chinese retail giant Shein to Paris's BHV department store, Frédéric Merlin has faced a barrage of criticism. Presenting himself as a self-made man from a middle-class background, in reality the 34-year-old is thriving on lucrative real estate deals and unpaid debts.

title: How the Swiss Alps are pushing higher to preserve access to snow
subhead: Zermatt, the famous ski resort at the foot of the Matterhorn, has invested hundreds of millions of Swiss francs to ensure skiing for its customers nearly year-round, despite global warming. It is a relentless strategy – criticized, but profitable.

title: Dining at Pierre Soulages' table
subhead: 'A Meal at the Museum' (1/6). In the southern region of Aveyron, Christophe Chaillou, the chef of Café Bras adjoining the Musée Soulages, prepares fresh, local cuisine shaped by market offerings.

Six thousand new perfumes in 2025: Why manufacturers are flooding the market
subhead: The perfume sector is experiencing a global consumption revolution: Young people are collecting bottles, and Chinese consumers are buying more and more. With L'Oréal leading the way, perfume has become the main sector driving the cosmetics industry.

title: Semiconductors: Nvidia at the heart of the new Pacific battle
subhead: 'Microchips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (1/5):  Whether it's AI, electronics or defense, the 'silicon economy' drives the entire industrial and service sectors. It is at the heart of a fierce battle between global powers, with China seeking to free itself from dependence on US technologies.

title: How dining etiquette reveals social divides among young people
subhead: Choosing a natural wine, slicing comté cheese the 'right' way, opening an oyster: For young people lacking the right social codes, embarrassment at the table is often inevitable.
